meanings.definition: Considered in relation or in proportion to something else.
meanings.sent1: The size of the box was relative to the size of the toy.
meanings.sent2: The price of the house was relative to its location.
meanings.sent3: The relative size of the cake made it look like a giant cupcake.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness was relative to the amount of chocolate she had.
meanings.sent5: The speed of the car was relative to the amount of gas in the tank.

meanings.definition: A person connected by blood or marriage; a family member.
meanings.sent1: My aunt is a close relative who always gives great advice.
meanings.sent2: Family reunions are a time to catch up with relatives.
meanings.sent3: The relative at the party told the funniest jokes.
meanings.sent4: She is the relative who always brings delicious desserts.
meanings.sent5: The relative's birthday party was full of laughter and joy.

meanings.definition: A person who is connected with another or others by blood or marriage.
meanings.sent1: The relative traveled from far away to attend the wedding.
meanings.sent2: She is a distant relative who I only see during holidays.
meanings.sent3: The relative surprised everyone with a special gift.
meanings.sent4: The relative's arrival brought excitement to the family gathering.
meanings.sent5: The relative's stories about the past were always fascinating.
